person.handwriting:
The hand is almost upright and shows unusual evenness of line. The hand is probably identical with that of 478. In the formation of individual letters it has a marked resemblance to 479, but the latter is less compactly written and its hand has an upward slant toward the right. (Michigan Papyri, Vol. VIII, p. 54.)
The time at which the letter was written (at night) and the general similarity of the handwriting with PMich 478 and 479 suggest that Terentianus himself was the scibe. (White, 1986, p.173)
person.name: Claudius Terentianus
